page.title: 02MAWNAN OLD CHURCH
page.content: The name Mawnan came from a monk named {St.Maunanus}who was supposed to have come to Mawnan in the 6th century.He used the sanctuary well.The{church}was dedicated to him it was built of granite in the 13th century on the site of an ancient earthwork.The church is in a beautiful position over-looking the mouth of the Helford river.Once it was going to be whitewashed so that it could be used as a lighthouse for shipping but it never happened.Many people visit the church which was restored inthe 19th century.People come from different countries to admire the view,to look at the church, the embroidered kneelers and to study the gravestones for mention of their ancestors.The church should have been built at Nansidwell but the'little men'moved the stone to the Toll Headland.
